dict.string: TODO: • Try to improve parameters list syntax – scope numbers, ‘=’, ‘,’ and possibly be intelligent about entity ordering • Is meta.function-call the correct scope? I've added it to my theme but by default it's not highlighted

(?x) (^\s*)? # 1 - Leading whitespace ( # 2 - meta.embedded.line.empty.php ( # 3 - Open Tag (?: ((?<=\?>)<) # 4 - Consecutive tags | < ) \?(?i:php|=)? ) (\s*) # 5 - Loneliness ((\?)>) # 6 - Close Tag # 7 - Scope ? as scope.php ) ( \1 # Match nothing if there was no # leading whitespace... | (\s*$\n)? # or match trailing whitespace. )

This now only highlights a docblock if the first line contains only /** - this is to stop highlighting everything as invalid when people do comment banners with /******** ... - Now matches /**#@+ too - used for docblock templates: http://manual.phpdoc.org/HTMLframesConverter/default/phpDocumentor/tutorial_phpDocumentor.howto.pkg.html#basics.docblocktemplate

In PHP, any identifier which is not a variable is taken to be a constant. However, if there is no constant defined with the given name then a notice is generated and the constant is assumed to have the value of its name.
(?x) \s*(array) # Typehint \s*(&)? # Reference \s*((\$+)[a-zA-Z_\x{7f}-\x{ff}][a-zA-Z0-9_\x{7f}-\x{ff}]*) # The variable name \s*(=) # A default value \s*(array)\s*(\()

(?xi) \s*(array) # Typehint \s*(&)? # Reference \s*((\$+)[a-z_\x{7f}-\x{ff}][a-z0-9_\x{7f}-\x{ff}]*) # The variable name (?: \s*(?:(=)\s*(?:(null)|((?:\S*?\(\))|(?:\S*?)))) # A default value )? \s*(?=,|\)|/[/*]|\#|$) # A closing parentheses (end of argument list) or a comma or a comment

(?xi) \s*([a-z_][a-z_0-9]*) # Typehinted class name \s*(&)? # Reference \s*((\$+)[a-z_\x{7f}-\x{ff}][a-z0-9_\x{7f}-\x{ff}]*) # The variable name (?: \s*(?:(=)\s*(?:(null)|((?:\S*?\(\))|(?:\S*?)))) # A default value )? \s*(?=,|\)|/[/*]|\#|$) # A closing parentheses (end of argument list) or a comma
Functions in a user-defined namespace (overrides any built-ins)
Root namespace function calls (built-in or user)
PHPDocumentor only recognises lines with an asterisk as the first non-whitespaces character
Escaped from the regexp – there can also be 2 backslashes (since 1 will escape the first)
Escaped from the regexp – there can also be 2 backslashes (since 1 will escape the first)
Escaped from the PHP string – there can also be 2 backslashes (since 1 will escape the first)
Unclosed strings must be captured to avoid them eating the remainder of the PHP script Sample case: $sql = "SELECT * FROM bar WHERE foo = '" . $variable . "'"
Unclosed strings must be captured to avoid them eating the remainder of the PHP script Sample case: $sql = "SELECT * FROM bar WHERE foo = '" . $variable . "'"
Unclosed strings must be captured to avoid them eating the remainder of the PHP script Sample case: $sql = "SELECT * FROM bar WHERE foo = '" . $variable . "'"
Unclosed strings must be captured to avoid them eating the remainder of the PHP script Sample case: $sql = "SELECT * FROM bar WHERE foo = '" . $variable . "'"
This contentName is just to allow the usage of “select scope” to select the string contents first, then the string with quotes
